title: Cricket: Why Sarfaraz Ahmed was sacked as Pakistan captain
text:
Sarfraz Ahmad has lost his job as Pakistan captain (Picture: Getty)

Pakistan Cricket Board chairman Ehsan Mani says it was in the ‘best interests’ of the team to remove Sarfaraz Ahmed as captain.

Azhar Ali has been appointed Pakistan Test captain for the rest of the year after Sarfaraz, 32, was sacked. Babar Azam will take charge of the T20 team until next’s years World Cup.

The change comes following Pakistan’s disappointing 3-0 defeat to Sri Lanka in a T20 series in Lahore.

Azhar Ali was appointed Pakistan’s new Test skipper (Picture: Getty)

Sarfaraz made scores of 24, 26 and 17 during the series but could not lead Pakistan to victory against a second-string Sri Lanka side.

Explaining the decision to sack Sarfaraz, Pakistan Cricket chief Ehsan Mani said: ‘His loss in form and confidence is visible.

‘In the best interests of the team it has been decided to leave him out and provide him the opportunity to reflect and regroup himself and try to reclaim his form away from international cricket.’

World Cup star Babar, who was the vice-captain of Pakistan’s T20 side before his promotion, said: ‘To be named captain of the No 1-ranked side in the world is the biggest thing that has happened to my career to date.

‘I am ready for this challenge and also willing to learn more in the process. I feel it has been a natural progression for me and I am delighted that the PCB has put faith in my capabilities.’

Pakistan’s new Test skipper Azhar, meanwhile, added: ‘These are exciting times in Pakistan cricket with a new team management.

‘As a captain, I feel comfortable that there will be number of knowledgeable people in the hut who I can rely on for advice and guidance.’
